docs.lead_paragraph: President Bashar al-Assad’s public activities mask increasing aggression in battle and belie fears among many supporters of an American attack.

headline.main: Assad Wages War Shielded With a Smile
headline.print_headline: Assad Wages War Shielded With a Smile

docs.abstract: Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad’s public activities mask increasing aggression in battle and belie fears among many of his supporters that an American attack is imminent; for two and a half years, Assad has never wavered from his position that the uprising is a foreign plot, and he continues to refuse to express any responsibility or remorse for the country's bloody turmoil, which he steadfastly refuses to call a civil war.
docs.snippet: President Bashar al-Assad’s public activities mask increasing aggression in battle and belie fears among many supporters of an American attack.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from New York, and Ben Hubbard from Beirut, Lebanon. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.
byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and BEN HUBBARD
